result.execSummary:
The defendant Everette Dale Sarnstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Comply with any conditions imposed by the probation agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Everette Dale Sarnstrom

4:16 pm   and 14CM185
Defendant Everette Dale Sarnstrom in court with attorney Robert A Wertheimer.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State:  def to plead amended co ord disorderly conduct in 14CM185; impose $210.80 forfeiture and complete Restorative Justice Program.   Amended information filed on 14CF131 amending to misd battery   S/W probation 1 year recommended   cond: 2 weeks jail.  Amended Information filed with the court.  Court reads the amended charge of misd battery.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Def pleads guilty to the amended charge of misd battery in 14CF131.  Atty Wertheimer stips to the facts.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates def guilty of misd battery.  Froelich makes sentencing argument.  State is asking for 2 weeks jail with Huber privileges.  Criminal history is traffic related.  Court asks about the 14CM185 incident.  Wertheimer makes sentencing argument.  
Def addresses the Court.  Mrs Sarnstrom addresses the Court.  
COURT ORDERS:
S/W PROBATION 1 YEAR
CONDITIONS:   
COURT COSTS $243 AND DNA SURCHARGE $200
COMPLY WITH ANY CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE PROBATION AGENT AFTER COMPAS ASSESSMENT
Appeal rights are given to the defendant.   Contact probation agent tomorrow morning.
